Comment: Hi everyone!  Does anybody get a sinking feeling when you think you have a lost game.  You wave the white flag and in a post-match analysis with your opponent he tells you there was a way out and when he does it seems so bally patently obvious.  Here is an old game against Coach Ion that only now can I bring myself to annotate it.  I play the Nimsovich-Rossilimo Attack of the Sicilian but guess who ends up on the defensive .........
3. Bb5+ - this is the start of the Nimzovich-Rossilimo Attack - this is about as aggressive as I get!

29. ....... Qd8.  Here I overlook the fact that Glenda has time to get to f3 to defend Fou Leblanc and wave the white flag. I used to resign in the pre-Freddy era when faced with unavoidable mate so here is one advantage of playing games out to mate - you avoid this scenario.   Although, notice, my a4 pawn is hanging and Ion has 2 chances to take it as Glenda has had to move away from its protection.  This would have left me with a very difficult endgame with my remaining pawn structure busted.  In those circumstances it was still worth playing on. Thankfully premature resignation on my part has been a very rare occurrence.
